title: Drawing, "Lady Esther Yacht: Cantilevered Table and Chair", ca. 1934–35
medium: Graphite on tracing paper, double ruled border in graphite
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in the left margin at center: 44 3/4.
description: Design for office/bedroom in Lady Esther Yacht. Two small, square windows with drawn Venetian blinds on left wall. Low armchair in lower left corner facing desk. Rounded chair back also forms the armrests; upholstered leather (?) padding on back and arms. Armrests curve down to become front legs. Back legs slightly splayed outward and connect to back rest and seat. Deeply padded seat cushion. Cantilevered table/desk extends from built-in cabinetry on left wall. Desk is rounded at right side, with one thick, straight leg for support. Decorative fixture/drawer handle on left side of desk. Above desk at left is long rectangular lighting fixture attached to built-in cabinetry. Three-drawer cabinet on left wall extended from desk. Drawers have long, rectangular drawer pulls. Cabinet unit extends on far wall, with identical three-drawer cabinet. To right of drawers is radio (?), radiator (?). Pierced area of cabinetry on outer surface, vents or grates below. Doorway to right of cabinets.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Lady Esther Yacht: Cantilevered Table and Chair", ca. 1934–35.
ca. 1934–35. Graphite on tracing paper, double ruled border in graphite. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-305-1.
